intro: Cuspidaria ramentacea, commonly known as the woolly cuspidaria, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its distinctive, hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Cuspidaria ramentacea is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
